column4: University of Ghent in Belgium divests and cuts ties with Israeli research centers after student mobilization

Indigenous knowledge is how we must move forward to live. 

Repost from @congofriends
â€¢
â€œBasandja centers around ancestral ecology â¬‡ï¸

which is an approach that revives ancient Indigenous knowledge as a practice that advocates for a holistic understanding of, and connection with, the earth.

Here the earth is seen not merely as a repository of material resources but as a holobiont, an ensemble of closely associated species interlinked through complex symbiotic relationships that hold the entirety of life systems in balance.

The story unfolds as a profound journey into the soul of the Isangi community and Tolaw villagers to map an ancient exchange with the forest that spans millennia.â€
.
.
This text is an excerpt from an article that our friends over at @terralingua.langscape published recently.

The article is an excellent exploration of what Basandja looks like in practice, as well as a fantastic behind-the-scenes into the upcoming Basandja film that documents what how indigenous wisdom is being leveraged at the grassroots levelâ€”

from the rainforests to the minesâ€”

to bring about the changes Congolese people need.
.
.
Check out the article at terralingua.org/langscape_articles/basandja/ (or Google â€œterralingua basandjaâ€)

Also be sure to check out the trailer for Basandja at basandjafilm.org.

There is nothing greater than Jewish Joy.  And THIS, right here...THIS is Jewish Joy. â 
â 
Iâ€™m throwing it back to last weekend, celebrating my best friendâ€™s daughterâ€™s bat mitzvah.  My best friend who I met in 6th grade, and  became friends with as media center aids in the 8th grade. (We were in charge of the reference section...swipe all the way â¡ï¸ for proof.) â 
â 
We became friends at the same age our daughters are now. â 
â 
But last weekend, despite all the darkness in the world around us, the light came on and we celebrated BIG TIME. Together with many of our friends from growing up and college, we put all of the Jewish Joy on the table. â 
â 
One of the most special parts about this weekend is that this friend of mine is the one who taught me to appreciate what it means to be Jewish. 

This is a friend who listened to David Broza or Debbie Friedman, while most of us got into our cars in high school and popped in a mixed tape filled with @Phish (or that other band we no longer listen to.)
â 
This is a friend who has more friends who are rabbis than most people have friends (which inherently means I do too...), and that makes us both incredibly #blessed. â 
â 
She instilled in me the value of going to temple, knowing the meaning of the prayers and the importance of surrounding myself with Jewish community.  Ultimately, she was the one who convinced me to go on the trip that changed my life forever, @motlorg.â 
â 
And so celebrating the bat mitzvah my daughter in October and her daughter this past weekend, TOGETHER, has meaning beyond no other. And rght now, there is simply nothing better than a Jewish milestone celebration.  So find yourself a friend whoâ€™s having a bar or bat mitzvah...or one whoâ€™s getting married. â 
â 
You will walk away with your heart filled in a way that I promise will carry you far into the next week and beyond. â 
â 
And do you want to know the best part?  I get to do it all over again in a week...and then again three weeks later.  All with my oldest, dearest and closest of friends from growing up.
â 
We are so damn lucky. #AmYisraelChaiâ 
ğŸ“¸ @lefko76
â

Succulent & Easy-to-make pasta ğŸ

ğŸ¥: @joandbart

Follow @recxipes for moreğŸ

Ingredients (for 2):

-A drizzle of olive oil
-3 cloves of garlic
-1 shallot
-2 tbsp tomato paste
-spices : salt, pepper, pili-pili, parsley
-Ã  bit of pasta cooking water
-double cream - 100 ml
-uncooked rigatoni- 200g
-100g mozzarella (less or more depending on your taste)
-Basil for the topping

Instructions:

â€¢Brown garlic and shallots in olive oil.

â€¢Add the tomato paste and spices. Stir.

â€¢Add pasta cooking water, cream and stir.

â€¢Add the cooked pasta and stir.

â€¢Add the mozzarella and stir.

â€¢Itâ€™s ready and you can add mozzarella as you like and top with basil.â€¨â€¨â€¢if you want the sauce to be more homogeneous you can add butter and stir again

ğŸ§‹NEW BOBA ALERTğŸ§‹

Fresh off the plane from Taiwan, @comebuytea_seattle is the newest boba shop in town. Their Teapresso Machines brew a fresh cup of tea for every order, meaning youâ€™re not drinking tea thatâ€™s been sitting for hours! Watching the steam and noise of each drink being made was like being in Willy Wonkaâ€™s factory. 

This is only the second ComeBuyTea location in the USA, so ğŸ“Capitol Hill should feel pretty special! I strongly recommend ordering a tea based drink, like their Hong Kong Milk Tea or the Sun Moon Lake Black Tea. Iâ€™m not sure what they put in their waffle batter, but you absolutely cannot miss it. The mango waffle was the highlight for me, and Iâ€™m intrigued by the corn & ham waffle. Add ComeBuyTea to your list of favorite boba shops to hit before a night out in Capitol Hill ğŸ˜‰ğŸ’Œ

4 months of progress - comment or DM â€œscheduleâ€ for my workout schedule ğŸ¤

consistent sloppy action will always beat â€œonce in a whileâ€ perfection

I used to think that unless the workout was 30+ minutes, it â€œdoesnâ€™t countâ€ - so as I entered the world of motherhood, it became harder and harder to feel like I was accomplishing something as my time for me became less and less. 

Now being a mom of 2 I can proudly say that I have recognized that consistent short, or even easy workout sessions have CARRIED me to my goals. 

Of course every once in a while I have more time available to me, but as a general rule I now know that even if the workout is 10 minutes or â€œjust a stretchâ€, itâ€™s contributing to my consistency streak.
